unnormalised: **Inventory Forecasting Crucial for Diwali Demand, Says CII Report**
normalised: Inventory Forecasting Crucial for Diwali Demand, Says C I I Report

unnormalised: New Delhi – A recent Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) report highlights the critical role of accurate inventory forecasting for manufacturers gearing up for the Diwali season. Demand for consumer goods, from electronics to sweets, surges dramatically during the festival of lights, placing immense pressure on supply chains.
normalised: New Delhi – A recent Confederation of Indian Industry (C I I) report highlights the critical role of accurate inventory forecasting for manufacturers gearing up for the Diwali season. Demand for consumer goods, from electronics to sweets, surges dramatically during the festival of lights, placing immense pressure on supply chains.

unnormalised: The report emphasizes that companies like Tata Steel and Mahindra & Mahindra are increasingly relying on advanced AI-powered forecasting models to predict demand fluctuations and optimize stock levels. Incorrect forecasting can lead to lost sales or, conversely, excess inventory and storage costs, especially for perishable goods like ingredients for festive treats, including the ever-popular biryani.

unnormalised: Experts suggest incorporating real-time data, including social media trends and competitor pricing, into forecasting algorithms. The Indian Institute of Management (IIM), Ahmedabad, is reportedly offering specialized courses on supply chain analytics to address the growing need for skilled professionals in this domain. Furthermore, better logistics planning is essential, specifically to accommodate the increase in shipments during this period, impacting supply chain strategies across regions from Kashmir to Kanyakumari.
